title: Omit `items:{}` (itâ€™s the default)
description: When `items` is the always-true schema (`{}` or `true`) it adds no restriction and should be omitted.

comprehensiveExamples.title: Wrong: items:{} on array
comprehensiveExamples.description: An always-true items schema is the default and should be omitted.

comprehensiveExamples.title: Wrong: items:true on array
comprehensiveExamples.description: Boolean true is equivalent to {}; omit it for brevity.

comprehensiveExamples.title: Right: Constraining items is meaningful
comprehensiveExamples.description: Specifying a schema inside items restricts element types.

message: Remove `items` when it is the always-true schema.
